qas.question: What operating system is used on Wayback Machine's servers?
When does Wayback Machine save a copy of a website?
What is the ultimate aim of the Wayback Machine?
What operating system is used on the internet's servers?
When does the internet save a copy of a website?
What is the ultimate aim of the visitors?
Where can sites be captured by Linux clusters?

plausible_answers.text: content that otherwise would be lost whenever a site is changed or closed down

qas.question: What Linux nodes are hoped to be captured?

context: Since 1996, they have been archiving cached pages of web sites onto their large cluster of <a0_0><b3_0>Linux<b3_0/><a0_0/> nodes. They revisit sites every few weeks or months and archive a new version <a1_0><b4_0>if the content has changed<b4_0/><a1_0/>. Sites can also be captured <b6_0>on the fly<b6_0/> by visitors who are offered a link to do so. The intent is to capture and archive <b7_0>content that otherwise would be lost whenever a site is changed or closed down<b7_0/>. Their grand vision is <a2_0><b5_0>to archive the entire Internet<b5_0/><a2_0/>.
